unnormalised: EV Charging Scene Heating Up, Yaar!
normalised: E V Charging Scene Heating Up, Yaar!

unnormalised: The electric vehicle revolution is picking up speed faster than a Mumbai local during rush hour, and the charging infrastructure is finally catching up. Forget range anxiety woes, more and more charging stations are popping up across India, from Leh to Kanyakumari!
normalised: The electric vehicle revolution is picking up speed faster than a Mumbai local during rush hour, and the charging infrastructure is finally catching up. Forget range anxiety woes, more and more charging stations are popping up across India, from Leh to Kanyakumari!

unnormalised: IIT-Delhi researchers recently announced a breakthrough in fast-charging tech, promising to juice up your EV battery in under 30 minutes. Imagine, chai-samosa break and your car’s ready to roll!
normalised: I I T-Delhi researchers recently announced a breakthrough in fast-charging tech, promising to juice up your E V battery in under thirty minutes. Imagine, chai-samosa break and your car’s ready to roll!

unnormalised: Private players are also joining the game. Sharma Electric, a startup based in Bangalore, is planning to install charging points along the Bangalore-Chennai highway, while Reliance is aggressively expanding its charging network.
normalised: Private players are also joining the game. Sharma Electric, a startup based in Bangalore, is planning to install charging points along the Bangalore-Chennai highway, while Reliance is aggressively expanding its charging network.

unnormalised: Even smaller towns like Patna are getting a slice of the EV action. Remember that scene in "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" where Raj misses the train? Now, imagine him arriving in an EV and having to wait 4 hours to charge! Thankfully, that won't be a problem for long, with new stations coming up left, right, and centre.
normalised: Even smaller towns like Patna are getting a slice of the E V action. Remember that scene in "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" where Raj misses the train? Now, imagine him arriving in an E V and having to wait four hours to charge! Thankfully, that won't be a problem for long, with new stations coming up left, right, and centre.

unnormalised: The price of charging varies, but expect to pay around Rs. 15-20 per unit. Some stations even offer subscription plans! All this means easier, greener travel for everyone – and less reliance on polluting petrol pumps. Next up: EV charging on the moon? Let's wait and watch!
normalised: The price of charging varies, but expect to pay around rupee fifteen to twenty per unit. Some stations even offer subscription plans! All this means easier, greener travel for everyone – and less reliance on polluting petrol pumps. Next up: E V charging on the moon? Let's wait and watch!
